intro: Cyrtandra paliku, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. Cyrtandra paliku is often found in moist, shaded environments within native Hawaiian forests. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat and is considered a keystone species in certain ecosystems.
